Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on free speech and fundamental human rights.
The government lacks the objectivity and capability to discern truth from falsehood.
Past instances, such as the pandemic, show that what was labeled misinformation was later proven true.
The bill could cause more harm by censoring truthful information, as seen in the example of COVID-19's origin.
Main Themes: Government overreach and lack of objectivity
Historical examples of misinformation being later validated
